contents.content: _{You may need to pick a subclass (bloodline, doctrine etc).}
_{Optionally, -2 in two abilities and +2 in one other.}
_{Two +2 from your background, one a free choice.}
_{Gain proficiencies from your background and class.}
_{Your proficiency bonuses at level 1 are: 0, 3, 5, 7 and 9. They increase as you level up.}
_{Become trained in a number of skills based on your class.}
_{If two sources give you training in the same skill, they don't add up. You may be able to spend the training elsewhere.}
_{Pathfinder Society characters must be at least young adults, and may not be evil.}
_{Check online to see which options are legal.}
_{Gain networking points to represent your training with the Pathfinder Society.}

rows.name: _{1pt}
rows.bonus: _{Your free consumable may be taken from your school's item list.}

rows.name: _{2pts}
rows.bonus: _{Trained in one lore skill. At level 5, gain a bonus skill feat.}

rows.name: _{3pts}
rows.bonus: _{Second free consumable taken from your school's item list, up to half your level.}

contents.content: _{[b]Networking points[/b] can be spent to buy consumables or lore skills.}
_{Gain 50% extra downtime between missions (12 days rather than 8).}

rows.name: _{Spells}
rows.bonusfeats:
_{Arcane Sense, Assurance,
Quick Identification, Recognise Spell}

rows.name: _{Swords}
rows.bonusfeats:
_{Cat Fall, Experienced Smuggler,
Forager, Hefty Hauler}

contents.content: _{Your faction gives you a faction boon.}
_{[b]Achievement[/b] points can be used to purchase boons, or access ancestries or classes.}
_{A new PFS character will have no fame or reputation. You may carry achievement points between your characters.}
_{Find a game through your local Venture-Captain or online.}
_{Start each game with one hero point and a free comsumable.}
_{Holy water, lesser bomb (alchemist), lesser antidote, lesser antiplague, minor healing potion}
contents.title: _{Pick from:}

contents.content: _{Lesser healing potion, potion of water breathing}
_{[b]Fame[/b] represents your standing within the Pathfinder Society. Fame can be use to purchase faction boons.}
_{[b]Reputation[/b] represents your standing within your faction. A higher reputation unlocks faction boons you can purchase.}

_{Some rangers believe civilization wears down the soul, but still needs to be protected from wild creatures. Others say nature needs to be protected from the greedy, who wish to tame its beauty and plunder its treasures. You could champion either goal, or both. You might be a scout, tracker, or hunter of fugitives or beasts, haunting the edge of civilization or exploring the wilds. You know how to live off the land and are skilled at spotting and taking down both opportune prey and hated enemies.}

_{You can single out particular foes to hunt, making you better at defeating them. You target and brutalize your chosen foe with either a bow or melee weapons, while supporting your allies with your skills.}
contents.title: _{During combat encounters...}

contents.content: _{When you speak, its with the voice of practical experience, especially involving wilderness exploration.}
contents.title: _{During social encounters...}

contents.content: _{You guide your allies through the wilderness or follow tracks. You keep an eye out for trouble, constantly alert for danger even when its not overt.}
contents.title: _{While exploring...}

contents.content: _{Attack with a weapon or unarmed. On a critical success, deal double damage and possibly other effects.}
contents.title: _{Strike}

contents.content: _{Drop an item or take one hand off a weapon. Does not trigger reactions.}
contents.title: _{Release}

contents.content: _{Postpone your turn until later; jump in as a free action. You cannot use reactions until then.}
contents.title: _{Delay}

contents.content: _{Prepare an action to take outside your turn on a certain trigger.}
contents.title: _{Ready}

contents.content: _{Pick a target as the focus of your attacks. Get +2 to seek and track, and reduce range penalty.}
contents.title: _{Hunt Prey}

contents.content: _{Cannot use more than one of these at once.}
_{You can only use this once per turn.}
_{Must be the first open or attack action this turn.}
_{Use your body rather than a weapon.}
_{May use 10 + proficiency bonus (inc level, but no other bonuses) rather than roll.}
contents.title: _{Assurance}

contents.content: _{Take 10 minutes to identify a magical item, location or effect.}
contents.title: _{Identify Magic (Nature/other)}

contents.content: _{Attempt a check against the target's Will DC; the GM may adjust the DC based on attitude or circumstances. Fail if the target is hostile or unfriendly.}
contents.title: _{Command An Animal (Nature)}

contents.content: _{Move at up to half your travel speed while making checks every hour.}
contents.title: _{Track}

contents.content: _{Pick a single target you can see or hear. Get a bonus to Perception and Track your prey.}
contents.title: _{Hunt Prey}

contents.content: _{Deduct hardness, then apply remaining damage to both shield and yourself.}
contents.title: _{Shield Block}

contents.content: _{Successful saving throws against poison reduce effect by 2, or by 3 for a critical success.}
_{On failing a Reflex save, take half damage.}
_{See in darkness and dim light, but only in black and white.}
contents.title: _{Darkvision}

contents.content: _{Successful saving throws against poison reduce effect by 2, or by 3 for a critical success.}
_{Gain the benefit of the Cover Tracks action at all times. Anyone tracking you must make a Survival check against your Survival DC.}
_{Enemies are flat-footed to you (-2 to AC) when in difficult terrain.}
_{Designate a single creature you can see or hear as your target.}
_{Ignore the first ranged increment penalty when within second range}
_{Use Hunt Prey as a free action a the start of your turn.}
_{Spend an action to command your animal companion.}
_{Otherwise they will act as they please.}
_{Animals get two actions which they take on your turn, and no reactions.}
